comment_data.body: In `DartVmServiceDebugProcess::scheduleConnect` there's a check for whether the debug session has ended before the connection starts, but I'm not sure what the equivalent is to check for here.
Is there a process we can query here, to see if it's still alive? I image there's something in the run state that we can check.
Can this declaration move inside the `try` block?
Perhaps add a comment indicating that we're looking to resume any paused-at-start isolates here.

The other changes (in the new commit) look good.

I assume from the question here that you'd want to find a way to address this (checking for process termination) before landing this PR?
Yeah I didn't find an easy way to do this but figured I'd look around a little more.
Exposing the process handler status seems to work here.

commit.message: Move vmservice declaration and add comment
Add check for whether process has terminated

repo.description: Flutter makes it easy and fast to build beautiful mobile apps.

title: Show run console and skip breakpoints during test run
